reviewText: Very interesting Movie. Very pity no eng subtitles.

Just what you want it to be. A rounded report on the creation and life of a house by a master. With contemporary interviews and historic family footage. Unfortunately, there's no footage or audio of neutra himself, but there's footage of his now elderly son.

One of the best 45 minute movies I ever seen. It is beautifully produced and extremely charming. We need more movies of this caliber. I'm impressed with Kelly Lynch's appreciation and dedication to the mid-century masterpieces she owns.
Bravo Kelly . You and Mitch make the world a better place .I can just imagine you as a kid trekking over to see the Malcolm Willey house .

The movie tells the story of homeowner Richard Oyler, architect Richard Neutra, and their unlikely friendship. It's a short film and recommended to fans of architecture and Neutra.

The film is beautifully shot, but this is a DVD-Only release, no Blu-Ray version. The film still looks good "upconverted" when watched with a Blu-Ray player.
